tables.table_title: Table 1 Comparison of the proposed models for the GPP according to the features revised in Stage 2
rows:
Probabilities are
assigned to solutions in
terms of their distance
to a centroid $x_{0}$, so
interactions are
modelled implicitly.

The interactions
between variables are
modelled implicitly as
solutions are described
as paths in the lattice

The model is unimodal,
so, low.

Numerical methods are
required when learning
MLE of parameters.
Sampling is carried out
with low time-
complexity.

Low time-complexity
methods are used when
learning and sampling

Good, as the model has a
centroid solution and a
variance parameter.

It depends on the
correlation between
the objective function
and the distance-
metric employed.

It is not clear how the
paths are translated to
the quality of solutions
